intro: Oldenlandia flosculosa var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in fine pubescence. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens.
